algorithm_technique: In-place modification using the first row and first column as markers for zero rows/columns, with separate flags for the first row/column itself.
problem_summary_simple: If a matrix element is zero, set its entire row and column to zero.
problem_summary_technical: In-place solution uses the first row and column as auxiliary space to mark rows/columns to be zeroed.
key_insights: The challenge is to achieve O(1) space complexity.
Using the first row and first column of the matrix itself as markers is a clever way to avoid extra space.
Special handling is needed for the first row and first column because they are used as markers, so their original zero status must be preserved.
